sentence.Network_en: In the kingdoms of the world, position meant self - aggrandizement.
sentence.Network_cn: 在属世的诸多王国里, 地位总意味著 自我 尊大.

sentence.Network_en: He has never exhibited the self-confidence, bordering on arrogance, of his predecessor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从未表现出他前任的那种近乎傲慢的自信。

sentence.Network_en: I felt so self-conscious under Luke's mother's intense gaze.
sentence.Network_cn: 在卢克母亲审视的目光下，我感到极不自在。

entry.tran: (在名利、权势上的)自我扩张，自我提升
entry.def: If you say that someone is guilty of self-aggrandizement, you mean that they do certain things in order to make themselves more powerful, wealthy, or important.

example.ex: He was interested in service, not self-aggrandisement.
example.tran: 他热衷于服务他人，而不是追求更高的名利。

means.word_mean: 1. an act undertaken to increase your own power and influence or to draw attention to your own importance
